message:
npx create-react-app mp2 --template typescript
The directory mp2 contains files that could conflict: .github/
notes: Create-react-app failed because target directory already contained files.

message: Explained that mp2 already exists and suggested options: use a new directory, remove/rename existing folder, or create app in subfolder and keep .github.
command: (advice) rm -rf mp2  OR npx create-react-app mp2-new --template typescript OR mkdir -p mp2/app && cd mp2/app && npx create-react-app . --template typescript

message: Clone the repository git clone git@github.com:cs409-fa25/mp2.git ... If it doesn't work because the folder exists, instead make the react app in a different directory and copy it over into this repo OR copy the .github folder and all files within to your created React project.
notes: User described preferred workflow for initializing React project while preserving .github.

message: Confirmed user's steps and provided two clear options with exact shell commands to create app elsewhere and copy files or copy .github into new app, plus git reconnection steps. Offered to generate a bash script to automate.
command: (advice) cp -r, rm -rf .git, git init, git remote add origin ...
notes: Provided full CLI workflows for both options.
